intro: Tetratheca viminea, commonly known as the slender tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and related species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, wiry stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Tetratheca viminea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
